unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply principles of statutory interpretation and the doctrine of precedent to interpret primary legal sources (case law and legislation) for the purpose of deriving legal rules and principles.
Apply principles of academic honesty and rules for correct legal citation.
Analyse legal problems in their broader social context
Define, describe and relate sources of legal norms and foundational elements of the Australian legal system.
Locate relevant primary and secondary sources through legal research using online databases, library resources and internet sources.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Readings and reflection in preparation for lectures and tutorials.

assessments.description: This timed online quiz requires students to demonstrate their understanding of foundational concepts necessary for further study in law attained derived from lectures and readings throughout the unit.
Consists of five (5) online multiple choice quizzes where students will demonstrate their ability to carry out legal research using online databases, library and internet sources.
Two online multiple choice quizzes in which students will demonstrate their ability to apply principles of academic integrity and rules for correct legal citation.
Consists of a group report (online wiki) in which students aim to develop recommendations for legal and policy reform to address a contemporary socio-legal problem.
Consists of a short assignment (max 1,500 words, excluding footnotes) submitted online in which students will analyse and interpret primary legal sources (case law and legislation).
Consists of a group presentation (of findings reported in the Law and Policy Reform Wiki) and contribution to Q&A sessions from other presentations.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 3, Intensive attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit will enable students to attain the key legal skills (legal research, reasoning, and writing; applying precedent; statutory interpretation; and legal problem solving) and to acquire the foundational legal knowledge (Australia legal institutions; legal theory; comparative legal systems; parliamentary process; role of the judiciary) necessary for further study in law. This unit will challenge students to apply their skills and knowledge to examine a contemporary socio-legal issue through a collaborative group project. Students will also engage in reflective practice.
data.title: Foundations of Law

description: This unit will enable students to attain the key legal skills (legal research, reasoning, and writing; applying precedent; statutory interpretation; and legal problem solving) and to acquire the foundational legal knowledge (Australia legal institutions; legal theory; comparative legal systems; parliamentary process; role of the judiciary) necessary for further study in law. This unit will challenge students to apply their skills and knowledge to examine a contemporary socio-legal issue through a collaborative group project. Students will also engage in reflective practice.
title: Foundations of Law
